result.execSummary:
The defendant Rollie M Tappa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rollie M Tappa is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rollie M Tappa was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Credit for 273 days.

AS OF 2/05/2016: Sentence to run concurrent with present sentence.
Concurrent with: to his present sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution is $2,357.99 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision as follows: $500.00 to Value Care Pharmacy and $1,857.99 to Value Care's Mutual Insurance Co. (to be paid before costs/fines) To be paid joint and several with co-defendants.

Costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with: any Value Care, Walgreens or the co-actors.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

Defendant Rollie M Tappa in court, in custody and by video from Stanley Correctional, with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   Pable Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rollie M Tappa in court, in custody, with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

8 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 273 days)
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

Sentence to run consecutive to his present sentence:

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
  
*No Use or Possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with:  any Value Care, Walgreens or the co-actors
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
RESTITUTION:  $500.00 directly to Value Care Pharmacy and $1857.99 to Value Care's Mutual Insurance Co. (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rollie M Tappa in court, in custody, with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State files an Amended Information and it is accepted by the Court.  Attorney Redetzke waives reading. The Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count #11 of the amended information.  Counts #5, #6 are dismissed and Count #12 is  dismissed and read into count #11.  The State and Attorney Redetzke withdraw any filed motions.   The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report to be filed with the Court by Monday, November 9, 2015.  The Clerks Office to prepare an OTP for Defendant to appear at the sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  The jury status and jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 and September 22, 2015 has been canceled from the Court's calendar and the Defendant can be returned to Stanley Correctional Institution forthwith.
